definition: to have experienced a lot of/to have been through
old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]
to experience/to undergo/to pass through/all/each/every/history
old variant of 歷|历[li4]
calendar
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
to have been through the hardships of life/to have been through the mill

sentences.english: I'm not speaking as someone who has been through the mill and picked and chosen my games.
sentences.chinese: 我不会像一个历尽磨难的人说，去选择我的比赛。

sentences.english: Love that matures through hardships is the most passionate love.
sentences.chinese: 历尽艰辛而成熟的爱情是最热烈的爱情。

sentences.english: The revolutionary army had a hard time of it when they captured the city.
sentences.chinese: 革命军占领该城市时历尽了艰辛。

sentences.english: We experienced great difficulty in taming tigers.
sentences.chinese: 我们在驯服老虎的过程中历尽艰辛。

sentences.english: But one of his successors in the White House had about as checkered a youth as can be imagined.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在白宫他的一位接班人青年时代却历尽艰辛。

sentences.english: The vicissitudes, the wind and rain is rough, the great motherland experiences the tribulation.
sentences.chinese: 沧海桑田，风雨坎坷，伟大的祖国历尽磨难。

sentences.english: Look at these dreams so beaten and so battered.
sentences.chinese: 看看这些历尽沧桑的梦想。

sentences.english: She has buffeted about from pillar to post for ten years.
We've been through a lot but we're still together. It must be fate.
sentences.chinese: 我们历尽沧桑后仍然在一起，必定是命中注定的。

sentences.english: You I for the sake of ideal and through all difficult, just to the road to success.
sentences.chinese: 你我为了幻想而历尽了艰难，才走向了成功之路。

sentences.english: Gone through life and death, suffering, Ma Cuifen finally helm Tang.
sentences.chinese: 历尽生死磨难，马翠芬终于执掌唐家。

sentences.english: Go through vicissitudes of life , your needing to learn to ignore over.
sentences.chinese: 历尽沧桑，你要学会忽略过去。

sentences.english: In the recession, our firm went through a bad time.
sentences.chinese: 我们公司在经济衰退时期历尽艰辛。

sentences.english: Sick in Brazil Clay Cross, has gone through many hardships.
sentences.chinese: 克莱在巴西贫病交加，也历尽磨练。

sentences.english: But their stay in Dongguan was to be full of hardships.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他们在东莞的日子却历尽艰辛。

sentences.english: Over the history of its existence the Russian merchant fleet has seen the moments of boom and decline.
sentences.chinese: 在俄罗斯的历史上，商船队可谓是历尽荣辱。

definition: to have been through the hardships of life/to have been through the mill
to experience/to go through
a torment/a trial/tribulation/a cross (to bear)/well-tried
kalpa (loanword) (Hinduism)
wind and frost/fig. hardships
to torture/to torment
destitute/difficulty/hardship/trouble
untold dangers and difficulties (idiom)
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
lit. to comb one's hair in the wind and wash it in the rain (idiom)/fig. to work in the open regardless of the weather
affairs of life/things of the world
great changes/ups and downs/vicissitudes/abbr. of 滄海桑田|沧海桑田[cang1 hai3 sang1 tian2]
destitute and homeless (idiom); displaced and without means
variant of 磨難|磨难[mo2 nan4]
to go through thick and thin (idiom)
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
